image.Creator: Galí, Beth (Spanish architect and author, born 1950); Quintana, Marius (Spanish architect, landscape architect, Barcelona, 1954-)
image.Title: Fossar de la Pedrera
image.Street_Address: Carrer de la mare de Deu del Port, Montjuic
image.Description: Beth Gali and Marius Quintana, architects. Old stone quarry and civil war communal grave (1936-39). Transformed into a memorial to those killed by the Franco regime, and a mausoleum to Lluis Companys, president of Catalunya, shot here 1940.
image.Work_Subject: memorials; landscape architecture; mausoleums; public art; outdoor sculpture; quarries (extracting complexes); adaptive reuse

image.Creator: Gaudí, Antoni (Spanish architect, landscape architect, and furniture designer, 1852-1926)
image.Title: Chapel of Colonia Güell | Cripta de la Colònia Güell | Església de la Colònia Güell
image.Style_Period: Art Nouveau
image.Artstor_Classification: Architecture and City Planning|Garden and Landscape
image.Street_Address: Santa Coloma de Cervelló
image.Description: The Church of Colònia Güell is an unfinished work by Antoni Gaudí. It was built as a place of worship for the people in a manufacturing suburb in Santa Coloma de Cervelló, near Barcelona (Spain). Colònia Güell was the brainchild of Count Eusebi de Güell. However with Güell losing profits from his business, the money ran out and only the crypt was completed. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Church_of_Col%C3%B2nia_G%C3%BCell
image.Image_View_Description: allée of plane trees with close view of end tree

image.Creator: Gaudí, Antoni (Spanish architect, landscape architect, and furniture designer, 1852-1926); Jujol, Josep M. (Spanish architect, teacher, and painter, 1879-1949); Martinez Lapeña, José Antonio (Spanish architect, born 1941)
image.Title: Park Güell | Parc Güell
image.Artstor_Classification: Architecture and City Planning|Garden and Landscape
image.Street_Address: Carrer d'Olot
image.Description: Josep Maria Jujol, joint architect. The park was originally part of a commercially unsuccessful housing site, the idea of Count Eusebi Güell, after whom the park was named. It was inspired by the English garden city movement; hence the original English name Park (in Catalan the name is "Parc Güell"). The site was a rocky hill with little vegetation and few trees, called Muntanya Pelada (Bare Mountain). ... The intention was to exploit the fresh air (well away from smoky factories) and beautiful views from the site, with sixty triangular lots being provided for luxury houses. It has since been converted into a municipal garden. Renovated 1991-96 by José Antonio Martinez Lapeña, with Jordi Farrando, Elias Torres, Ignaci de Lecea, and A. Ribas. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Park_G%C3%BCell
image.Work_Subject: landscape architecture; open spaces; public gardens; renovation

image.Street_Address: Carrer d'Olot
image.Description: Josep Maria Jujol, joint architect. The park was originally part of a commercially unsuccessful housing site, the idea of Count Eusebi Güell, after whom the park was named. It was inspired by the English garden city movement; hence the original English name Park (in Catalan the name is "Parc Güell"). The site was a rocky hill with little vegetation and few trees, called Muntanya Pelada (Bare Mountain). ... The intention was to exploit the fresh air (well away from smoky factories) and beautiful views from the site, with sixty triangular lots being provided for luxury houses. It has since been converted into a municipal garden. Renovated 1991-96 by José Antonio Martinez Lapeña, with Jordi Farrando, Elias Torres, Ignaci de Lecea, and A. Ribas. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Park_G%C3%BCell
image.Work_Subject: landscape architecture; open spaces; public gardens; renovation

image.Title: Fossar de las Moreres | Moreres Cemetery
image.Street_Address: next to Santa Maria del Mar
image.Description: Site of the cemetery of the Catalans who defended Barcelona from the Spanish king, Felipe II, 1714. Space reclaimed as public square, dedicated as memorial to the martyrs.

image.Creator: Galí, Beth (Spanish architect and author, born 1950); Quintana, Marius (Spanish architect, landscape architect, Barcelona, 1954-)
image.Title: Fossar de la Pedrera
image.Street_Address: Carrer de la mare de Deu del Port, Montjuic
image.Description: Beth Gali and Marius Quintana, architects. Old stone quarry and civil war communal grave (1936-39). Transformed into a memorial to those killed by the Franco regime, and a mausoleum to Lluis Companys, president of Catalunya, shot here 1940.
image.Work_Subject: memorials; landscape architecture; mausoleums; public art; outdoor sculpture; quarries (extracting complexes); adaptive reuse
image.Image_View_Description: threshold stairs to trellis and pool

image.Creator: Gaudí, Antoni (Spanish architect, landscape architect, and furniture designer, 1852-1926) architect
image.Title: Casa Milà|La Pedrera
image.Style_Period: Modernist
image.Street_Address: 92, Passeig de Gràcia
image.Description: It was commissioned by businessman Pere Milà i Camps and his wife Roser Segimon i Artells, from Reus and widow of the wealthy Indian Josep Guardiola i Grau. At the time it was very controversial because of the bold undulating stone facade and twisted wrought iron that decorate the balconies and windows, designed mostly by Josep Maria Jujol.... -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casa_Mila

image.Creator: Gaudí, Antoni (Spanish architect, landscape architect, and furniture designer, 1852-1926); Jujol, Josep M. (Spanish architect, teacher, and painter, 1879-1949); Martinez Lapeña, José Antonio (Spanish architect, born 1941)
image.Title: Park Güell | Parc Güell
image.Artstor_Classification: Architecture and City Planning|Garden and Landscape
image.Street_Address: Carrer d'Olot
image.Description: Josep Maria Jujol, joint architect. The park was originally part of a commercially unsuccessful housing site, the idea of Count Eusebi Güell, after whom the park was named. It was inspired by the English garden city movement; hence the original English name Park (in Catalan the name is "Parc Güell"). The site was a rocky hill with little vegetation and few trees, called Muntanya Pelada (Bare Mountain). ... The intention was to exploit the fresh air (well away from smoky factories) and beautiful views from the site, with sixty triangular lots being provided for luxury houses. It has since been converted into a municipal garden. Renovated 1991-96 by José Antonio Martinez Lapeña, with Jordi Farrando, Elias Torres, Ignaci de Lecea, and A. Ribas. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Park_G%C3%BCell
image.Work_Subject: landscape architecture; open spaces; public gardens; renovation

image.Creator: Gaudí, Antoni (Spanish architect, landscape architect, and furniture designer, 1852-1926); Jujol, Josep M. (Spanish architect, teacher, and painter, 1879-1949); Martinez Lapeña, José Antonio (Spanish architect, born 1941)

image.Description: Josep Maria Jujol, joint architect. The park was originally part of a commercially unsuccessful housing site, the idea of Count Eusebi Güell, after whom the park was named. It was inspired by the English garden city movement; hence the original English name Park (in Catalan the name is "Parc Güell"). The site was a rocky hill with little vegetation and few trees, called Muntanya Pelada (Bare Mountain). ... The intention was to exploit the fresh air (well away from smoky factories) and beautiful views from the site, with sixty triangular lots being provided for luxury houses. It has since been converted into a municipal garden. Renovated 1991-96 by José Antonio Martinez Lapeña, with Jordi Farrando, Elias Torres, Ignaci de Lecea, and A. Ribas. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Park_G%C3%BCell
image.Work_Subject: landscape architecture; open spaces; public gardens; renovation

image.Creator: Forestier, Jean-Claude Nicolas (French landscape architect, 1861-1930)
image.Title: Parc Montjuic
image.Street_Address: Montjuic Hill
image.Description: Park encompasses Palacio Nacional (now the Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya). 1929-30 Barcelona Exposition grounds designed by J.C.N. Forestier and Maria Rubio i Tudurí Nicolau; however, landscape left unfinished. Master plan for 1992 Olympic Ring by MBM, Arquitectos (Martorell, Bohigas, Mackay).
image.Work_Subject: sports complexes; exhibitions (events); Olympic Games (25th : 1992 : Barcelona, Spain); world's fairs; Exposición Internacional de Barcelona (1929-1930)
image.Image_View_Description: central axis stairs looking to Palacio Nacional

image.Title: Jardi Botanic de Barcelona | Jardín Botánico de Barcelona | Botanical Garden: Barcelona, Spain
image.Artstor_Classification: Garden and Landscape|Architecture and City Planning
image.Street_Address: Mount Montjuic between the Castle and the Lluis Companys Olympic Stadium
image.Description: 14 hectare botanic garden set amongst a number of stadiums used in the Olympic Games of 1992. Commands views of much of the Barcelona metropolitan area.

image.Creator: Gaudí, Antoni (Spanish architect, landscape architect, and furniture designer, 1852-1926)
image.Title: Chapel of Colonia Güell | Cripta de la Colònia Güell | Església de la Colònia Güell
image.Style_Period: Art Nouveau
image.Street_Address: Santa Coloma de Cervelló
image.Description: The Church of Colònia Güell is an unfinished work by Antoni Gaudí. It was built as a place of worship for the people in a manufacturing suburb in Santa Coloma de Cervelló, near Barcelona (Spain). Colònia Güell was the brainchild of Count Eusebi de Güell. However with Güell losing profits from his business, the money ran out and only the crypt was completed. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Church_of_Col%C3%B2nia_G%C3%BCell

image.Creator: Gaudí, Antoni (Spanish architect, landscape architect, and furniture designer, 1852-1926)

image.Style_Period: Art Nouveau
image.Street_Address: Santa Coloma de Cervelló
image.Description: The Church of Colònia Güell is an unfinished work by Antoni Gaudí. It was built as a place of worship for the people in a manufacturing suburb in Santa Coloma de Cervelló, near Barcelona (Spain). Colònia Güell was the brainchild of Count Eusebi de Güell. However with Güell losing profits from his business, the money ran out and only the crypt was completed. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Church_of_Col%C3%B2nia_G%C3%BCell
